page.title: 09 COUNTRY LIFE IN KEMPSTON
page.content: Some of the{houses in Kempston Rural vary in age from 300 years to under 5 years. Box End House, Church End cottages and Kempston House and nearby cottages were built in the 14th century from{bricks made from local {clay.}The residents appreciate its beauty and peace. They value the privacy of their own gardens and views of fields, trees and the river. Gardening, walking, cycling, horse- riding and studying nature are favourite leisure occupations. There are nurseries & riding stables in the area and the{River Ouse}is renowned for its fishing. It is also used by a nearby Youth Centre to teach people canoeing. There are plenty of{mature {trees}affording a natural habitat for wildlife and providing favourite playing places for children, and of interest to photographers & artists.
